Leonardo.Action: Fights bravely to protect others, showing a heroic and self-sacrificing stance.
Carefully lays down his swords and kneels with head bowed, indicating respect and humility.
Pulls out a single katana sword, poised for battle, faces down Pantera confidently.
Leaps into frame, lays down his katanas carefully, kneels with eyes closed stating training is complete.
Inhales the sewer slime and smiles wide, saying 'home sweet home'.
Tiptoes carefully through lair to avoid disturbing others.
Kneels respectfully before Splinter and expresses readiness for next stage of training.
Shows visible emotional response (touched) when receiving ancient medallion from Splinter.
Jumps off the jet liner's landing gear and skillfully deploys a hang-glider from his backpack, control and precision demonstrated.
Rises from disgusting sewer slime, inhales and smiles wide, showing mental resilience and calm confidence.
Tiptoes with ninjitsu precision across the lair, carefully avoiding making noise.
Walks in to kneel before Splinter and confidently states he has completed his training and is prepared for the next stage.
Hugs Splinter upon reunion, expresses sincere affection.
Responds appreciatively to Raphael's congratulations but remains somewhat reserved.
Responds to Mikey's enthusiastic hug with warmth and friendliness, gently asking him to let go.
Accepts the responsibility of leadership from Splinter despite feeling the weight of it.
Responds politely and appropriately to Raphael's awkwardness and tension.
Somewhat hesitant and awkward greeting brothers, struggles to immediately command the typical confidence expected.
Greets Mikey warmly and shows interest in friends' well-being by asking about April and Casey.
Jokes lightly about Casey's habits and stays friendly during conversation with his brothers.
Passes by Donatello's room during an explosion without reprimanding or showing frustration, simply leaves with Mikey.
Calmly leaves a smoky hazardous area after Donatello says he has it under control, showing trust and composed judgement.
Engages in casual conversation about his surroundings and friends, indicating situational awareness and social intelligence.
Passively asks questions about others instead of taking proactive action or following up, exhibiting some passivity.
Disapprovingly critiques Mikey's admiration of the Nightwatcher, expressing concern about showboating and potential danger to the group.
Disapproves of the Nightwatcher's showboating and recognizes the potential danger it causes to them all, suggesting someone needs to warn him.
Leo feverishly works out, displaying dedication to training and self-improvement.
Expresses frustration that others are not training or ready, indicating high standards and leadership expectations.
Sighs when teammates are delayed or distracted, but does not take immediate corrective action.
Considers Splinter's advice about leadership and motivation, then smiles indicating thoughtful reflection and adaptability.
Initiates playing ninja tag, indicating playfulness and inclusiveness.
Engages in a friendly competition and agrees to the bet with Raphael.
Accidentally causes Raphael to fall face-first into a wall.
Initiates a competitive challenge ('Ninja tag, topside!') confidently.
Engages in high-risk rooftop gauntlet race with his teammates, showing readiness and leadership.
Accidentally slips and causes Raphael to crash into a brick wall while navigating obstacles.
Initiates a conversation trying to address tension with Raphael, admits he would understand if Raphael were upset.
Sarcastic remark implying Raphael is not upset, escalating conflict.
Accuses Raphael of thinking Splinter likes him best, provoking him.
Engages in a tense and emotionally charged conversation with Raphael attempting to understand and address the underlying conflict.
Slips and accidentally causes Raphael to hit a brick wall during a team obstacle course.
Calls out to stop Raphael from recklessly rushing into danger.
Remains calm and focused on planning with others rather than rushing in.
Recognizes the need to come up with a plan when facing uncertainty.
Shouts at Raphael to stop him from rushing off but fails to do so, resulting in lack of control over the situation.
Shows hesitation and burden of leadership when deciding how to deal with the Foot; questions their values about life.
Engages in expert katana exchange with Karai but does not escalate violence, allowing the Foot to escape.
Rolls eyes at Raphael's eagerness for violence.
Shows hesitation and internal conflict about the value of life and helping the Foot despite their past, indicating thoughtful leadership.
Engages in an expert katana duel with Karai resulting in a stalemate, demonstrating skill and composure.
Stops when confronted by Karai, allowing the Foot to escape, potentially missing an opportunity to prevent their escape.
Calmly tells Raph to save his anger for another day, helping to defuse tension among the group.
Points out the mistake of going to the dangerous location, emphasizing caution over reckless behavior.
Points out that they should not have been at the location in the first place, showing reflection and responsibility for the situation.
Engages in a tense argument with Raphael, insisting on taking responsibility alone.
Calls Raphael 'Hothead' in a somewhat teasing manner during a quiet moment.
Takes responsibility for the conflict with Raphael, acknowledging fault and responsibility.
Engages in a glare and silent tension with Raphael instead of de-escalating the conflict.
Responds quickly and attentively to the news report about a recent battle, showing alertness and readiness to act.
Bites his tongue hard when reprimanded by Splinter, showing restraint and respect.
Tries to explain difficulties in leadership after being blamed, showing openness but also defensiveness.
Dismisses Raphaels' approach as 'brute vigilante junk', showing intolerance toward a brother’s feelings and method.
Responds 'Whatever' dismissively when corrected by brothers about 'Nightwatcher' name.
Bites his tongue hard when reprimanded by Splinter, showing restraint despite inner frustration.
Acknowledges his role as leader but expresses doubt on how to maintain order, indicating self-awareness but some uncertainty.
Dismisses Raphael’s eagerness for brute force action with a calm, reasoned comment invoking 'Nightwatcher' as an example of a better approach.
Shows no visible effort to immediately resolve the issue or propose an active plan during the discussion, somewhat passive in leadership moment.
Leo, Don, and Mikey slip into the window stealthily to check on Raph, showing preparedness and caution.
Does not take a lead role or make any direct decisions or assessments in this excerpt, deferring mostly to Donatello for medical evaluation.
Engages with brothers' theories with light sarcasm and skepticism, maintains group discussion.
Questions Donatello's deduction and shows skepticism about the threat of villains trying to take over the world.
Advocates for careful planning and restraint instead of rushing into a fight, telling Raphael to hang back and analyze first.
Suggests hanging back, analyzing the situation, and formulating a plan before taking action.
Calls out Raph's impulsive plan as the worst idea, demonstrating judgment and leadership.
Paces anxiously, expresses concern about Mikey playing video games before a crisis.
Questions whereabouts of Raphael, showing care for team members.
Rebukes Mikey for playing games in a tense moment, but underlying tone is concern.
Shows impatience by pacing and looking at clock, possibly indicating stress but also responsibility.
Paces back and forth anxiously, checking the clock, concerned about Raphael's absence.
Recognizes the seriousness of the situation (eve of Armageddon) and calls out Mikey for playing video games instead of focusing.
Fails to practice patience as advised by Splinter, showing signs of impatience.
Leaves the lair to find Raph after sensing leadership pressure and responsibility.
Effortlessly keeps up with a fast and skilled opponent through the city streets and back alleys, using throwing stars effectively during pursuit.
Calmly maintains secrecy while navigating dangerous urban obstacles like traffic, power lines, and oncoming buses during pursuit.
Acknowledges Nightwatcher's hard training with respect.
Expresses appreciation for Nightwatcher's intentions despite opposing him.
Lectures Nightwatcher to stop vigilante actions and gives him a chance to walk away.
Tries to explain that he trained to be a better leader for his brothers.
Calls Raphael impatient, hot-tempered, and says he is better than him.
Uses every bit of his control, restraint and expertise to surgically slice the bind under Night's helmet and knock him down.
Is surprised and pales when he realizes Night is actually Raphael, showing momentary shock and inability to anticipate this twist.
Explains he was training to be a better leader, showing dedication and intentional skill development.
Claims superiority by stating 'I'm better than you' in a heated argument, which comes off as smug and possibly alienating rather than skillful leadership.
Continues fighting with Raphael despite intense anger, shows resilience and commitment to brotherly duel.
Allows brother to pin him down without escalating violence, demonstrating restraint.
No visible hostile retaliation after being overpowered or betrayed by Raphael's anger.
Engages in a prolonged battle against Raphael despite being ultimately pinned and overwhelmed by his brother's anger.
Is caught off guard and too exhausted to effectively fight back when surrounded and captured by the Four Generals.
Gets tranquilized by the General's dart cannon, indicating he was caught off-guard or unable to avoid capture.
Despite being tranquilized, remains the target of concern and efforts from his brother Raphael, indicating his importance as capable leader.
No direct action or statement by Leonardo in this excerpt.
Slowly regains strength and stands up, looks at Raphael after being rescued.
Survives a dangerous situation and recovers strength after being unconscious.
Is found unconscious and apparently lifeless, requiring rescue.
Forgives Raphael after his apology.
Forgives Raphael after a tense moment, showing emotional control and leadership.
Fights an opponent faster than him, gets knocked into a glass display case, then quickly recovers using swords strapped to his body to continue the fight.
Teases Raphael lightly about working solo instead of alone.
Expresses worry about Casey handling monster alone.
Teams with Raphael to deliver a double roundhouse kick to General Aguila, effectively stopping him.
Shares a victorious moment with Raphael, showing camaraderie and leadership by celebrating the team's success.
Shares a meaningful hug with Raphael, signaling reconciliation and brotherly warmth.
Asks Karai to clarify her cryptic statement, showing openness and engagement rather than hostility.
Expresses confusion by asking 'Passed what?'
Agrees to keep Raphael's secret about the Nightwatcher gear and trusts him to handle the bike.
Plays and horsing around with his brothers during a game of ninja tag, engaging in fun and bonding activities.
